name: Overview
data: [{"id":"030f05f6-b9ea-4ae1-adb0-d65ce9df90ed","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":1,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor Class Documentation","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"838e1b03-6007-473f-be2d-353d1811d765","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Introduction","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ec04c204-abc5-453a-871e-b61cbdd07b7d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class is the central engine for static code analysis within this library. Acting as a specialized Python AST (Abstract Syntax Tree) visitor, it is responsible for traversing source code to extract deep structural and semantic information.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e1053dd2-ad3d-4044-a2bf-e7da9923a07f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Unlike basic syntax checkers, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" maintains a persistent state throughout its traversal. By simulating a call stack and managing scopes, it builds a comprehensive model of the code that understands not just the syntax, but the relationships and references between modules, classes, and functions.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4864ee12-c1f9-492b-9e25-7c963c1e1e8d","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Core Responsibilities","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"27dff417-a62b-481d-8253-65fc669da6b2","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The functionality of the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divided into three primary operational areas:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0b673fd6-dafc-4e16-a4de-f8346b22bd0b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"1. AST Traversal and Node Visitation","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7ec0c0ce-6f77-4007-9fa6-b04ba663632c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is the \"front-line\" of the analysis. As the processor walks through the syntax tree, it triggers specific logic for every Python construct it encounters. This area is further divided into specialized tasks:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6db6e5d5-7d86-4192-81c8-d47f312c50e7","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Module Initialization:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Handling the root file and its imports to set the stage.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7107b382-d7c9-4a0c-a2f3-13745563b8c6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Definitions & Structure:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Identifying the \"skeleton\" of the code (functions, classes, arguments).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"acecc846-0b66-44fc-998c-a05253ba0feb","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Control Flow:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Analyzing execution paths like loops, conditionals, and error handling.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d62a9125-dea8-43ea-8ffb-b777c2cfee2c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Data Operations:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Tracking actual execution logic, such as variable assignments and function calls.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d2b4bc11-e79b-4482-8058-62375234d89f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"2. Context, Stack, and Scope Management","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4026b1b3-a71a-41ef-bd89-057d1c9eb280","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"To understand code correctly, the processor must know \"where\" it is at all times. This management layer handles the simulation of the execution environment:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4580a746-796c-46b7-80c4-8fc7709065f7","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Lifecycle Control:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Managing the overall start, stop, and recursion of the analysis process.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1f01250a-dcc2-4a03-b79d-548ce1b61aa4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Stack Operations:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Pushing and popping contexts (like entering or exiting a function) to maintain a valid call stack simulation.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"df5c02de-8ae7-471c-ad95-6c7c30915b8a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Namespace Resolution:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" translating raw names into fully qualified, unique identifiers (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"my_var","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" becomes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.function.my_var","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bb2e1f0e-94a6-440d-96d5-39f4cf9fea72","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"State Merging:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Handling complex scenarios where code branches (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if/else","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" blocks) create divergent states that must be reconciled.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bfb30795-48ad-435e-9553-e47d7b36d7e9","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"3. Definition, Resolution, and Data Extraction","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a1466d7d-4ccb-4dba-bdc2-92ac049f3f62","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This layer provides the semantic intelligence. It bridges the gap between a raw syntax node and its actual meaning in the code:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b5b8f8dd-b497-4be4-9814-22ebabbde4cf","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Points-To Analysis:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Determining exactly what value or definition a variable refers to.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"398f5d0e-6be6-4e86-8b58-3be782cd1926","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Lookup Mechanisms:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Searching specifically for attributes, fields, or built-in functions within specific scopes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"990a6c0b-50f2-4f8b-b750-f8b07d89fa08","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Node Decoding:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Translating raw AST nodes into usable internal data formats.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6293e05f-9739-44cf-b3e0-2a8d7ea89d32","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Data Conversion:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" preparing the final analysis results for output or storage.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e4a825d1-f424-4add-963d-f9c362736585","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Utility","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"26a579bc-a6f5-4147-b2e9-b7194e52bd97","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The class also includes general utility functions, such as data flattening tools (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"flatten","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), to simplify complex hierarchical information during the analysis process.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e3e0d56a-6fcf-4bba-8685-cdf83616c62e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
